intro: Carthamus araneosus, commonly known as the spider thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its spiny, hairy stems and leaves that are typically lobed or toothed. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with radiating petals, which bloom in the summer months. It is often found in dry, disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments. Botanically, it belongs to the Asteraceae family, also known as the daisy or sunflower family.
